intro: Cynorkis hirtula, commonly known as the woolly corymbia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in corymbs, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
